candidates.title: Improve the quality of randomness in tests

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

candidates.body:
Instead of using hard-coded seeds, obtain them once using the `getrandom` feature and then seed the fast `XorShiftRandom` with them in order to have more random inputs in the related tests.
Note: this change is not possible everywhere, as some of the tests require a `CryptoRng`; in those cases, `StdRng` is used instead, and it's also seeded from the entropy provided by the OS.

candidates.body:
## Motivation

Refactor marlin and polycommit into algorithms, adds back nonnative gadgets

candidates.title: Removes deprecated logic
candidates.body:
## Motivation

Removes the following deprecated logic:

- Removes BW6 and Pedersen commitment from `snarkvm-algorithms`
- Removes BW6-761 and the BW6 template from `snarkvm-curves`
- Removes the short Weierstrass projective template from `snarkvm-curves`
- Removes block height from PoSW verify method in `snarkvm-dpc`
- Removes Fp768, Fp3, and Fp2_2over3 from `snarkvm-fields`
- Removes Edwards BW6, Groth16 verifier, Pedersen commitment, and nonnative gadgets from `snarkvm-gadgets`
- Removes the outer parameters from `snarkvm-parameters`
- Removes Sonic PC and Marlin PC gadgets from `snarkvm-polycommit`

candidates.body:
Unfortunately, `chrono` still hasn't seen the release of a new version dealing with its outdated `time` dependency and isn't currently well-maintained. The remaining audit warnings are of little cause for concern and should get resolved on their own once the relevant dependencies release new versions. 

Advisory: [RUSTSEC-2020-0159](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0159.html).

candidates.title: Dynamically generate the CUDA binary
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting the PR! We appreciate you spending the time to work on these changes! -->

## Motivation

This PR generates the MSM fatbin for each individual machine instead of having one provided in the codebase.

GPU Prover now runs with the following procedure:

1. Check if a valid fatbin exists (`.aleo/resources/cuda/msm.fatbin`). If it does, skip to step 4.
2. Check if the machine is cuda compatible and determine which gencode to use.
3. Generate and store the fatbin to `.aleo/resources/cuda/msm.fatbin`.
4. Load the fatbin and execute the GPU algorithms.

candidates.title: Remove `t` polynomial from Marlin
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting the PR! We appreciate you spending the time to work on these changes! -->

## Motivation

Improve Marlin proving speed and proof size by removing the commitment to the `t` polynomial. On my machine, this reduces PoSW time from 2.08s to 1.97s, so an improvement of roughly 5%. The proof size also reduces by 48 bytes (compressed). The security argument for this optimization is outlined in the Lunar paper.

Also introduces another change that switches our indexing from producing a single joint matrix to producing independent arithmetizations for each matrix. Furthermore, we reduce the size of our FFTs and witness polynomials by performing separate holographic linchecks for each matrix, and combining them via a new trick.

candidates.title: Reduce memory overhead and FFT size in Marlin prover
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting the PR! We appreciate you spending the time to work on these changes! -->

1. Sample the masking polynomial according to the distribution specified in [Lunar](https://eprint.iacr.org/2020/1069).
2. Reduce one FFT by splitting the computation of `z_a * z_b = (z_a' + r_a * v_H) * (z_b' * r_b * v_H)` as `z_a * z_b + r_a * r_b * v_H^2 + (r_a * z_b' + r_b * z_a') * v_H`. This is better as our FFT for the multiplication is smaller.
3. TODO: check if we can omit committing to the `t` polynomial
4. use execution pools for FFTs.

candidates.title: Compute commitments with limited threads in high-thread scenarios
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting the PR! We appreciate you spending the time to work on these changes! -->

## Motivation

When computing multiple MSMs, allocating an increasing number of threads to a single MSM results in diminishing returns. This PR allocates at most a fixed constant number of threads to a MSM, and instead computes multiple MSMs in parallel.

On a server machine with 24 cores, this results in a 25% speedup for PoSW proving.

vendor.tar.gz/snarkvm-curves/src/../documentation/the_aleo_curves/00_overview.md: No such file or director
y (os error 2)
  --> /private/tmp/nix-build-snarkos-unstable-2021-01-14.drv-0/snarkos-unstable-2021-01-14-vendor.tar.gz/s
narkvm-curves/src/lib.rs:22:10
   |
22 | #![doc = include_str!("../documentation/the_aleo_curves/00_overview.md")]
   |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: this error originates in the macro `include_str` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrac
e for more info)

candidates.title: Bump indexmap from 1.7.0 to 1.8.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [indexmap](https://github.com/bluss/indexmap) from 1.7.0 to 1.8.0.
Changelog

Sourced from indexmap's changelog.

  • 1.8.0

    • The new IndexMap::into_keys and IndexMap::into_values will consume the map into keys or values, respectively, matching Rust 1.54's HashMap methods, by @​taiki-e in PR 195_.

    • More of the iterator types implement Debug, ExactSizeIterator, and FusedIterator, by @​cuviper in PR 196_.

    • IndexMap and IndexSet now implement rayon's ParallelDrainRange, by @​cuviper in PR 197_.

    • IndexMap::with_hasher and IndexSet::with_hasher are now const functions, allowing static maps and sets, by @​mwillsey in PR 203_.

    • IndexMap and IndexSet now implement From for arrays, matching Rust 1.56's implementation for HashMap, by @​rouge8 in PR 205_.

    • IndexMap and IndexSet now have methods sort_unstable_keys, sort_unstable_by, sorted_unstable_by, and par_* equivalents, which sort in-place without preserving the order of equal items, by @​bhgomes in PR 211_.

.. _195: bluss/indexmap#195 .. _196: bluss/indexmap#196 .. _197: bluss/indexmap#197 .. _203: bluss/indexmap#203 .. _205: bluss/indexmap#205 .. _211: bluss/indexmap#211

  • Implement From<tokio::fs::File> for Body.
  • Fix blocking request-scoped timeout applying to bodies as well.
  • (wasm) Fix request bodies using multipart vs formdata.
  • Update internal rustls to 0.20.
Commits
  • 17890f8 v0.11.7
  • d73d961 fix blocking client to use request timeout for response body (#1395)
  • 8b37ae4 Support to rustls 0.20 (#1388)
  • 8fe22c4 Remove direct dependency on the time crate (#1390)
  • 161d731 add resolve to blocking client (#1384)
  • 0ef1a2e wasm: fix standalone/multipart body conversion to JsValue (#1364)
  • ab49de8 Body from tokio::fs::File (#1360)
  • be8ab7b docs: provide basic auth example (#1362)
  • See full diff in compare view
